title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.8 | 11-12-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: That Vyasadeva, he compiled the Srimad Bhagavatam under the instruction of Narada.
segments.summary: The lecture begins with an introduction to the verse being discussed, focusing on Vyasadeva compiling and teaching the Srimad Bhagavatam to his son, Shukadeva Goswami.

segments.key_quote: Because he was already engaged in self-realization he was a liberated soul by birth.
segments.summary: This segment discusses Shukadeva Goswami's unique position as a liberated soul from birth, explaining why he didn't undergo traditional Vedic studies.

segments.key_quote: Srimad Bhagavatam is the natural commentation on the brahma sutras compiled by the same author.
segments.summary: This section explains the relationship between the Brahma Sutras and the Srimad Bhagavatam, highlighting that the Bhagavatam is a natural commentary on the Brahma Sutras, both authored by Vyasadeva.

segments.key_quote: Material bondage means we have lost our freedom natural freedom which is there in our spiritual existence.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the concept of material bondage, explaining how it limits our natural freedom and subjects us to the laws of material nature.

segments.key_quote: Sense gratification will solve my problem but the remedial measure for all these problems is there in the Bhagavatam.
segments.summary: This segment discusses how sense gratification is an illusion and that the Srimad Bhagavatam offers the solution to material problems, emphasizing Shukadeva Goswami's liberation.

segments.key_quote: Therefore Srimad Bhagavatam is compiled not less than five thousand years ago.
segments.summary: The speaker addresses the age of the Srimad Bhagavatam, explaining how Srila Prabhupada arrives at the figure of five thousand years based on descriptions within the text and the beginning of Kali Yuga.

segments.key_quote: Vyasa deva is the one who compiled all this so he compiled the puranas then he compiled the mahabharata then he compiled the srimad bhagavatam.
segments.summary: This section discusses the order in which Vyasadeva compiled the Vedic literatures, including the Puranas, Mahabharata, and Srimad Bhagavatam, highlighting the importance of the Bhagavatam's description of Krishna's activities.

segments.key_quote: Srimad Bhagavatam is the science for following the path of nivritti marga.
segments.summary: The lecture concludes by explaining that the Srimad Bhagavatam is a science for following the path of nivritti marga (the path of liberation), contrasting it with pravritti marga and emphasizing its role in curing material disease.
